element-citation.article-title: Evidence that DNA-A of a geminivirus associated with severe cassava mosaic disease in Uganda has arisen by interspecific recombinations

note.p: These authors identified a new geminivirus variant that is a recombinant between African cassava mosaic virus and East African cassava mosaic virus and is associated with the epidemic of severe disease spreading through Uganda at the time. This highlighted for the first time the importance of mixed infections and recombination in the emergence of new disease epidemics in plants.
